uncertainties: True hepatotoxicity incidence difficult to assess given ubiquitous consumption worldwide
CYP1A2 polymorphisms affect caffeine metabolism but relationship to hepatotoxicity unclear
Whether case reports represent true hepatotoxicity versus confounding from energy drink additives or underlying conditions
Extremely rare case reports make mechanistic characterization speculative
citations: Chawla A, et al. Caffeine and liver disease. J Clin Exp Hepatol. 2011;1(2):99-103.
Freedman ND, et al. Association of coffee drinking with total and cause-specific mortality. N Engl J Med. 2012;366(20):1891-1904.
